event.title: an airline crash in Montana Sunday

data.event: Four of the 14 passengers who died in an airline crash in Montana Sunday had ties to Laurel County.

event.title: worked as a physician at Oneida Mountain Hospital for more than 30 years

data.event: Brent Ching, his wife Kristen and his children, Hailey, 6, and Caleb, 4, all of whom died in the crash, were related to the late Dr. Caleb Chu, who worked as a physician at Oneida Mountain Hospital for more than 30 years.

event.title: spoke to Perry, an anesthesiologist, Sunday

data.event: Priscilla Chu said she spoke to Perry, an anesthesiologist, Sunday.

event.title: visited the Ching family in August

data.event: Chu visited the Ching family in August and said the kids were a joy.

event.title: 11:30 a.m. Sunday, the plane was headed

data.event: Around 11:30 a.m. Sunday, the plane was headed to Bozeman, Mont., but rerouted suddenly to Butte.
The PC-12, which was built in 2001, nose-dived into Holy Cross Cemetery, just 500 feet short of the runway at Butteâ€™s Bert Mooney Airport.
Reports Tuesday showed ice might have been a factor in the crash.
